snippet: Research on a common lung cancer could foretell a type of treatment in which drugs — many of which are in the pipeline already — are chosen to match the genetic mutation in each patient.
abstract: First large and comprehensive study of the genetics of squamous cell lung cancer finds that more than half the tumors from the cancer have mutations that might be treated by new drugs that are already in the pipeline or that could be easily developed; study, lead by Dr Matthew Meyerson and published in journal Nature, is part of the Cancer Genome Atlas project.
lead_paragraph: Research on a common lung cancer could foretell a type of treatment in which drugs — many of which are in the pipeline already — are chosen to match the genetic mutation in each patient.

headline.seo: For a Lung Cancer, Drug Treatment May Be Within Reach
headline.main: Cancer Study Points to Tighter Pairing of Drugs and Patients
headline.print_headline: Study of Lung Cancer’s Genetics Suggests a More Tailored Treatment
